meanings.definition: Overburdened with excessive weight or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The backpack felt overloaded with heavy books.
meanings.sent2: The truck was overloaded with too many boxes.
meanings.sent3: The table looked comically overloaded with dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like an overloaded ship sinking under the weight of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The overloaded branches of the tree bent low under the weight of the snow.

meanings.definition: Overwhelmed with too much information or tasks.
meanings.sent1: The students felt overloaded with homework assignments.
meanings.sent2: The computer system crashed because it was overloaded with data.
meanings.sent3: The office printer seemed overloaded with too many print requests.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like an overloaded computer struggling to process all the information.
meanings.sent5: The overloaded inbox made it hard to find important emails.
